top_review_1:
Review by Ethan Shoe 
This was on a list of recommended restaurants for traditional Swedish food. It was a higher end restaurant, but definitely worth the price. I got the traditional meatball dish and it was great. Each meal comes with a salad and bread plate, already on the table when you arrive. Service was good, though I wish they checked on me more often.
top_review_2:
Review by Jessica Rodrigues 
We were in Stockholm for a few days but this restaurant served us incredibly good meatballs. The service was impeccable and attentive. The food was truly delicious, from appetizer to dessert everything astounded us and exceeded all our expectations. One thing is for sure, if I return to Stockholm I will come back here as well! highly recommended.
top_review_3:
Review by Stefan Hendrickx 
Would highly recommend for visitors interested in getting a selection of Swedish classics like the herring (SOS), meatballs, or Kroppkaka (my favourite). After sampling at different restaurants this remains our favourite.
Staff is very friendly and welcoming and though it's not the most local experience (it's in the old town after all) it is a great experience and atmosphere.

top_review_1:
Review by Philip 
Just wow. The food was amazing! Had one of my best food experiences with the mushroom plate and the Löjrom! Add great service and you’ll have a night you’ll never forget. Will definitely come back next time I’m in Stockholm.
top_review_2:
Review by Alexandros Giatzoglou 
Really nice experience. The level of food and service is very high. I totally recommend langoustine (Nordic lobster) starter and duck as a main.

What I would not recommend is booking table after 8.30 pm because at 11 pm sharp you need to leave and there may not be enough time to enjoy your dinner.
top_review_3:
Review by Amanda W 
One of hardest restaurants in town to get a table.  And it was definitely worth the visit.  Well prepared food with interesting blend of tastes at a reasonable price in a casual laidback setting. Excellent service and recommendation of wine to the dishes.

My favorites were the starter Kantareller med morot och lavendel and dessert - bakad vaniljkräm med salsa macadamianötter  och getostskum.  Yummy!

top_review_1:
Review by Liviu Popa 
The food is great and the staff was very friendly and offered nice suggestions for food and drinks.
One of the beat stakes I had in Stockholm.
top_review_2:
Review by Mike L. 
Ok so I am breaking down my review into two parts. One for the overall normal experience and the other for the special occasion.

1) Food: All the appetizers and main courses were tasty. The combo of flavors is definitely on point. Though for the lobster bisque I would personally prefer some lobster bits in it and the entrecôte ribeye itself can be a bit higher quality (nitpicking) but the seasoning and taste is good. The portions were just right so we weren’t too full or starving.

2) The service was great. Our waitress was super friendly and knew how to work the table! Honestly I don’t have too much to say because the service was that good.

3) Atmosphere was ok. Nothing stands out too much, it was fine. It could be a bit more spacious, since we bumped into the table behind us sometimes when we got up, but it was not like we couldn’t get out at all. Also parking might be a problem unless you go to the narrow parking garage nearby.

4) Price is high. It is an expensive restaurant but you get what you paid for…sort of. I think some dishes are definitely overpriced like the entrecôte which cost 450kr! Again the restaurant is located in Östermalm, an upscaled area, so what did I expect. Nevertheless, it is pricey but at least you will get good food.

So the special occasion is the reason why I am not giving a five star. It is unfortunate but I can’t ignore it.

We were there because we were celebrating a birthday. We brought a cake and asked if they could refrigerate it and serve it afterwards. Some places would do it for free, some would charge a small service charge. Both options are fine. But for  how much we were spending there, I thought they would do it for free. Other restaurants might decline but that’s rare. Instead came the absolute shock of my life.

The waitress told us they could do it for a service fee, which is fine but it was for per person! I repeat, the service fee was for per person! I am not joking. The service fee ended up costing more than the cake. In fact, you could have gotten an appetizer and a main. It was ridiculously expensive. Even the waitress thought it was extremely unfair. But since it was new years soon and we weren’t gonna see each other for a while, and not to ruin the mood, we paid for the service fee.

That why I can’t give a full five star, I mean you are only giving us some plates and cutleries, why are you charging so much?? For per person??? Even though not all of us had the cake…..
top_review_3:
Review by Omid Farahani 
One of Stockholms best venues for events and parties. The venue was super pretty and gave a luxury atmosphere white the food held the same standards with some really delicious courses. Melted in your mouth.

top_review_1:
Review by Maulida Rahma 
The fish soup (fish and shellfish casserole) tastes really great! I love it.
The chocolate lingonberry truffle is also delicious, (balance of sweetness and bitterness)!
A little too expensive but has a cozy atmosphere for small talk.
top_review_2:
Review by Papipupenta 
I believe that it is one of the best restaurant in Stockholm, Gamla stan. You must book in advance. Their meat, fish and others tasting were completely sophisticated . I would like to go there again if there is another opportunity to go Stockholm.
top_review_3:
Review by Eana Kim 
Wow the foods were so good! (ordered a reindeer dish, meatball, and casserole) All were super tasty and flavorful. Glad that I visited this place based on the reviews!

top_review_1:
Review by Norelys Rumbos 
The food is really good, it is so tasty. But the portion is small to the price.
We try the mushroom soup (amazing), the reindeer meat goals balls and a dish with an amazing sausage and a reindeer taco. All was amazing, expensive, but amazing
top_review_2:
Review by Alessandra Distefano 
Cabin-like vibe and atmosphere. Great traditional Swedish food. Mainly meat. Moose and reindeer. Friendly staff. Be aware that it’s located in a very touristy area. Better to plan your visit accordingly.
top_review_3:
Review by Hazel Brooks 
Highly recommended place to eat! We stopped by for a quick lunch and was so surprised by the quality of the food and drinks.

This was one of the best meals we have had so far in Europe to date - the Moose meatballs are exceptional.

We had Moose meatballs, Reindeer stew, beer, amazing Briska elderflower cider (not sweet, just nice), and their Vasa 1628 brandy. Everything was delicious.

*We ordered on a Friday from the lunch menu and revealed complimentary coffee and cookies afterwards.

Service was great - attentive and friendly staff who brought the orders quickly and checked up on us  without being pushy.

Overall cost about 70€, but was well worth it!

top_review_1:
Review by Georgi Karamanov 
The atmosphere of this restaurant is a delightful step into the past, with its cozy, vintage decor that oozes charm and nostalgia. The ambiance is warm and welcoming, making it the perfect place for a memorable meal. I was recommended this place by a lot of locals and guides. Fortunately for me, there was a single-person table in one of the corners. They take no reservation so it's luck in peak hours and you have to wait outside.

I was welcomed by two lovely ladies who operated the entire front. Now, onto the star of the show: the food. The meatballs at this restaurant are nothing short of legendary. They are the epitome of Swedish comfort food, tender, flavorful, and served with a heavenly cream sauce that's simply to die for. Each bite was a taste of culinary perfection, and it's easy to see why they're renowned. The shrimp toast here is equally exceptional. It's crispy on the outside and bursting with flavor. The combination of succulent shrimp and a delectable sauce is great. It's an absolute must-try for seafood enthusiasts just like everything else here.
top_review_2:
Review by Tanvir Hasan Sadi 
It’s worth the wait in the queue. Lovely old town atmosphere. Friendly service from the owner, they know how to cheer the customers, mouthwatering food, one dish is more than enough for one person. Must try the beef meatballs, best in the world!
top_review_3:
Review by ambuj sarkar 
It’s the best restaurant in Stockholm for Swedish food. Highly recommended for Shrimps and tuna dishes in the menu, even meatballs are awesome as well. Must go place for people who likes to eat good food.

top_review_1:
Review by Chris Ridzon 
My wife and I have eaten here several times, Chef Filip and his staff never disappoint. An outstanding experience from top to bottom with amazing locally procured cuisine with a contemporary touch. Attentive fine dining service with attention to every minor detail. The atmosphere is revolutionary and will surprise and delight your senses, throughout the dining experience. They truly deserve a second Michelin star in my opinion!
top_review_2:
Review by Sarah Chu Twisselmann 
Memorable experience with great surrounding and cozy atmosphere. The concept of sustainable and as much local ingredients as possible were inspiring and nice. The service was very comfortable and come with a great amount of soul. The dinner toke almost 4 hours, so don’t forget to set the necessary time for visiting this place.
top_review_3:
Review by Jonas Larsson 
It's not easy to get a table at Restaurant Äng but it's truly worth the time and the wait (4 months in my case). It's easily top 3 of my restaurant visits ever and a strong contender for the best.
The service is perfect the 16 courses are pretty much all magic. For what it is it's also affordable. My favourite is the esparagus variation followed by the fish in kimchi butter and ponzy with grapes from the farm. The new restaurant that opens in 2022 will be bigger and more expensive but probably also will worth it!
The most easy 5 stars a place can get! The only thing I'm not a big fan of is the interior design but i can look past that.

top_review_1:
Review by Olivia Gassner 
The most impressive dining experience I’ve ever had. Truly was blown away. From moving through the space, having first courses by the fire, sitting at chefs table and such lovely service / managers… really amazing. Loved all the fresh and local ingredients. Having the option to do the juice + wine pairing was perfect. Expect 3 hours +. Thank you from NYC!
top_review_2:
Review by Anna Chilton 
What an experience! The host, Ian, welcomed me even though I didn’t have a reservation. I was given a spot at the bar and tasted the smoky twist on an Old Fashioned, which was delectable. There is a handful of cocktails and each is a take on a classic. The wine menu is a thing of beauty, even by the glass. Swedish wine, both sparking (an affable variety, Solaris) and still, feature by glass and bottle menus. There are classic options and iconic wines, classy new world options (like Hamilton Russel) and an orange wine.
I was lucky to receive a tour of the kitchen where the chef kindly showed us how the wood fired Swedish ovens work. All the food is sourced as locally as possible, with many ingredients conserved from the summer months.
The menu is 16 courses. I only tried 4 and each morsel left a memory of layered, unfolding flavours and textures, crafted and sat on beautiful ceramics.
It’s worth noting the diversity of the youthful team, adding nuances to the dishes with inspiration from various regions in Sweden and further afield.
The atmosphere is relaxed enough to attract a diverse crowd of food lovers, there was a young couple, an older group of friends, a couple of lone travellers (me and an American lady). That said, you do know, as soon as you walk in, that you’ve entered into a place for serious food lovers. There’s a focus about the place, with each member of staff deeply attentive to the main event - serving you.
Prepare to be pampered into an olfactory journey by these masters of food and drink.
Worth a journey to Stockholm. Enjoy!
top_review_3:
Review by Julien Dyminski 
To this day, the best dining experience I have had, by far.
Service and presentation were perfect.
Flavors, textures and smells were beyond amazing, trying to describe them with words is futile as most felt either new or unknown.
The mixed pairing (wines and juices) is a great option.
Thanks to the whole Ekstedt team for this fabulous evening.
Booking might be the difficult part ; then for the experience itself plan at least 3 hours.

top_review_1:
Review by Dannie Hetz 
Favorite place for dinner in Stockholm!! Local friends met us there. Delicious food, excellent experience, the team were fun and did great with hosting us. We loved the concept of ordering each dish separately (instead of ordering all the courses in the beginning of the meal). It gave the evening a refreshing pace and something to think about and look forward to during the dinner itself 🤍 love it! Would definitely come back.

Ps - take the chocolate cake :)
top_review_2:
Review by Seth Guillory 
Really great experience for a romantic dinner. Lots of different options that you can choose a la carte, but we went with the 4 course meal + wine pairing. The wines were delicious and paired so well with each course. My favorite was the saddle of lamb, so tender and flavorful. I also was surprised with how much I loved the mushroom croissant!

For dessert, our wonderful serve recommended the wild chocolate which might be one of my favorite desserts of all time. It’s been on their menu since they opened for a reason, make sure you get this!!! Overall, such a delicious meal and great service from every interaction
top_review_3:
Review by T K 
Definitely worth a visit. We ordered pretty much everything on the menu and about half of them were incredible—creative ingredients and succulent.

The other half we’re still good but more “normal” and didn’t wow us as much.

Highly recommend getting the caviar toast. That was the most delicious caviar we’ve had so far, and such a generous amount. Other good dishes were the mackerel, mushroom dish, and herb icecream.

top_review_1:
Review by Noemi S. (Namydust) 
Absolutely a nice find!
Was looking for the reindeer meat all around but some of the places don’t have it so came here and they had it on the menu: I had to try it!
Delicious meat and delicious sides like potatoes, vegetables and very tasty meat sauce! Had also a nice local beer!
Recommended… Turkish family owns this restaurant and they are super welcoming!
It’s expensive… so expect to pay!
top_review_2:
Review by Rikhard Hartikainen 
Brought my American family after googling high ranked restaurants in old town Stockholm that would make them get the best side of Swedish cuisine and they truly got the best side. Incredible food, superb atmosphere and the waiters were incredibly professional. Thanks for making me proud to be Swedish to my family 🙏
top_review_3:
Review by Halley Chen (HC) 
I was there in the late afternoon on a Saturday and it was not too busy, so I was able to get an outdoor table right away. The food was really nice, I had the shrimp for the starter and reindeer medallions for meat. Both are savory and well-done. I also got the mousse for a dessert. Although tasty, it was too small for me. The waiter and waitress were super friendly and nice, and I enjoyed the whole experience. In the summer time, the outdoor area should be wonderful and the indoor should be cozy any time. Be mindful that they may ask you for additional tip which is not common in Sweden? But it is totally up to you.

top_review_1:
Review by this is eunice 
We initially had a bad first impression because the staff seemed rather stern and unenthusiastic, but the food was of great value for money. For the quality of the food I definitely would've been willing to pay more.

In particular I would recommend the breaded halibut and pork confit. The variety of potatoes that came with each main course also deserve a special mention. Seen lots of great reviews about the red wine braised ox cheeks but we personally found the red wine too intense.
top_review_2:
Review by Magnus Skog 
Cozy place with excellent cooking overall. Staff was friendly and the service fast. Hearty portions of comforting dishes to enjoy this cold November night. Great wine recommendations. Highly recommended!
top_review_3:
Review by Achi T 
The service staff were busy but moved quickly. Lunch came with soup and bread; I'm not sure if coffee was included because I ordered a latte. The lunch options included vegetarian, lamb, and beef, but I ordered fish. It was a sizable portion of fish, which was quite fresh. Overall, the meal was light and satisfactory.

top_review_1:
Review by Ciara 
The food was quite good, and it came hot and well plated. The restaurant was kept clean and tables were cleared quite quickly. However, I noticed some glass near the entrance inside was broken (no shards of glass had been left unswept to be clear), but this was my only concern. Tables are a little close together in spots, so they may be inaccessible to larger people or disabled people. Staff were not impolite and were quite friendly, yet after a while, they seemed to want us to leave as we had not ordered more food, which I suppose is quite fair. That being said, I do think Nomad is worth a visit for what I believe to be authentic Swedish meatballs at a decent price, and the atmosphere in the restaurant is quite pleasant, but I would advise that once you're finished your meal, either order dessert or don't overstay your welcome.
top_review_2:
Review by Jamie The Business Bear 
A really lovely place to visit and it was evident that the team and the chefs really enjoyed their work. Excellent attention to detail and some delicious dishes made for a really great visit. Good pilsner on tap too. The steak dish was beautifully cooked and the dessert was absolutely lovely. Would really recommend as a first stop in Stockholm.
top_review_3:
Review by Monica W 
Delicious food except for the actual meatballs, which tasted kind of overcooked and rubbery. My companion said, "At least you know they weren't frozen, they taste so homemade."

Friendly staff, fast service. Window seats a bit gross with all the old cushions... The normal seats and the rest of the interior look nice though, pretty good ambience. Close to the train station.

top_review_1:
Review by Noemi S. (Namydust) 
What an incredible food experience! One of the oldest restaurants in the world, more than 300 years old building!
The salmon was OUTSTANDING! We saw also other plates and they all looked great! Of course you need to pay a little bit more than usual to dine there, but it’s worth a visit at least once! And book ahead of time!
Nice waitresses, super nice and gentle!
top_review_2:
Review by Danielle Wood 
We found this restaurant on Google while looking for something that offered traditional Swedish food. The food, service, and experience did not disappoint. Our server explained this was the oldest restaurant in the world and opened in 1722. We enjoyed the shrimp and herring starters with classical schnapps, the Swedish meatballs and venison for mains, followed by the raspberry parfait. I'd highly recommend making a reservation as they are quite busy.
top_review_3:
Review by Amy Shin 
Very rustic local atmosphere for authentic Swedish food, especially the meatballs. Nothing mind blowing, but in a convenient location. I would pass on the salmon next time.

top_review_1:
Review by 哟哟哟LYC 
I walked in with the intention of ordering the same food as I was "ok" dining place through pictures from google posts.

They had none, possibly a change of chief... a bit disappointed. Then when the food got brought up, and you had a taste of it...

You never think of food the same way. Not like i haven't went to other fancy restaurants in all countries...

But...

Anyway, if you decided to come and saw that what i posted is no longer available, don't be too surprised. Just ask nicely of what is recommended, and hope you have fun!
top_review_2:
Review by natia zarqua 
Highly recommend this place, interior is nice, stuff is super attentive and food is very delicious. I ate spinach&ricotta cannelloni. Take into consideration that they are changing menu's periodically.
top_review_3:
Review by Dominika Vrábelová 
Lovely food, we weren’t blown away by the taste combinations but they were delicious anyway. We had veal and salmon, artichoke as appetizer.
Staff was very friendly and professional — made our visit that much better.

top_review_1:
Review by Gustaf Sjögren 
Recommended if you want to try classic Swedish cuisine.

Very friendly staff. Tasty gluten-free toast. Very nice classy locales. Received main courses 30 minutes after order so not the quickest service, but acceptable for the quality of food.

++Staff
+Food
+Gluten-free alternatives
+Locale

Only minus was that the heater was temporarily out of order which meant it was slightly colder than comfortable.
top_review_2:
Review by S Berman 
Loved everything about this place, from the doorman who greeted us and took our coats to the wait staff with the witty comeback who didn't mind taking our photos.

The food was amazing, and was a great introduction to Scandinavian food. I cannot recall the names of the dishes so the photos will have to do. Our friend's colleague regaled us with stories of notable figures who dined there. Yet, there was no air of snobbishness. In fact, for me, at least, it gave off a very nice cozy feeling.

Reservation is a must as it is a very popular place.
top_review_3:
Review by Sten Sun 
I visited here with my colleagues after work a little early.
I think the price is a little expensive, but they offer various and delicious menus, and I have enjoy it more deliciously because the manager even explained the food history himself.
I want to visit again next time and try all the menus. :)

top_review_1:
Review by Biesmans Mathijs 
We just had our NYE dinner here.
The NYE menu existed out of 5 courses for 1095 sek. If you wanted the accompanying wines it was 695 sek extra.

The atmosphere is great, old classy tavern vibes.

The food was okay to good. The taste of each ingredient on your plate fitted with the rest.
However, I’m not complete convinced that it justifies the price. But as it was New Year’s Eve, I guess we also paid for this special night.

I’m not familiar with Swedish hospitality as we’re visiting here, but it seemed the staff wasn’t specifically happy to be working on NYE.

All combined a 4/5. Nice food and a nice setting for Stockholm’s oldest restaurant.
top_review_2:
Review by Mike Forsman 
A very atmospheric restaurant in the heart of Old Town. Great food, great service, and wonderful atmosphere. Like all places in Old Town, the restaurant is expensive, but that is to be expected given the location. They have a great lunch and dinner menu which focuses on traditional Swedish meals. I can warmly recommend this place based on my experience there.
top_review_3:
Review by Praveen Joshi 
Awesome place of 17th century Tavern one of the 10 world’s oldest restaurants! Speaks of the history and food is amazing as well the service!!! We just loved the fish and vegetarian menu paired with best of french and white wine…! Just loved the candle light setup on a cozy swedish winter…!

top_review_1:
Review by Sebastian Gierth 
Extraordinary restaurant with great ambience. The dishes are laid out by taste and prepared very creatively. The presentation is very appealing and there is the possibility to order a wine corresponding to the dish in each case. The service is attentive and friendly, and the price-performance ratio is reasonable. A recommendation for all who want a very special taste experience that will be remembered.
top_review_2:
Review by Gail Bishop 
Visited Smak in Sep 2023. An absolute delight to find a tasting menu that has a dedicated vegetarian list of dishes and you can pick the ones you like!

I had a choice of 10 savoury and 4 sweet. Picked 3 savoury and 2 sweet. Every single one utterly delicious and packed with complex flavours. Wine pairings available too. Definitely quite a pricy meal (but we'd had some much cheaper meals earlier in the week so could justify this as an end-of-the-holiday treat).

I love the fact that their menu changes seasonally, and if I'm in Stockholm again any time soon, I will definitely be making another visit to Smak.
top_review_3:
Review by Pankaj Gupta 
Amazing experience. Food was amazing, the vegetarian menu was part of the theme and not an after thought. They paced the food with a lot of time in between, we sat for over 3.5 hours and it never felt rushed, even full or bloated after all the food. Wish we had the capacity to try each flavor. Highly recommended!

Only negative was it was packed and noisy.

top_review_1:
Review by Russell C 
I really enjoyed my meal here and would definitely visit again if I ever go back to Stockholm. I went for the meatballs with mashed potato, lingonberries, and pickles which was very good. Service was quick and friendly.
top_review_2:
Review by Rachel Cheung 
Found this local gem for lunch, they have 4-5 good options unlike most restaurants that only serve one dish for lunch at a discounted price. You can also get salad bread coffee and juice which is included. I am pleasantly surprised by the quality and portion given the super affordable price! ~160 sek. The decor is also very cozy and staff very attentive and considerate. Highly recommend if you are visiting the old town. We got the fish, potato pancake and meatballs. They all tasted great but even more so the pancakes as the ingredients are simple yet so tasty.
top_review_3:
Review by Tamami Naito-Badessa 
We came in the summer and ate here twice at our hotel concierge’s recommendation; the first night and the last night. We were skeptical at first since it was located in Old Town and in the middle of a touristy lane but I came for the meatballs and this place was it! And we left highly satisfied and came back the last evening for more meatballs, escargot and pickled herring. Husband had pan fried herring which he devoured. We sat at the bar, chatted up with the staff and ordered schnapps. The staff knows hospitality for sure and they made us feel right at home!

top_review_1:
Review by Aviad Tamir 
Had a business lunch there.
The service was super-professional and helpful.
The food was nicely-presented but both the tartar and the bisque that I ordered were WAAAY too salty. My colleagues who ordered other dishes confirmed that the level of salt was strongly indicating that the chef was in love😀
Very good wine selection.
top_review_2:
Review by Aiman 
Ok,  this should be a Michelin star restaurant, every single plate is an art …

I tried most of the menu at dinner , all are super delicious .

Amazing presentation for every single plate …

Service is superb, thanks to our host, Mr , Marco , he was a unique…

Thanks to the chef , you made our day …. If I plan to come to Sweden , he will be a reason for that …

Big thanks

We stay three nights here and had dinner on the second day. The food are very salty to us and the main dish are small for us as adults.

However, all the staff were nice. Only the food is not good. The seafood bisque just like the water from the sea..We drink 2 bottle of water after the meal.

top_review_1:
Review by Charbel Wakim 
Amazing place with very reasonable prices! The food is great and the portions are huge.

Try the love stew highly recommended 👍🏻
top_review_2:
Review by Philip Gissen 
Portal would be a popular restaurant in any city in the world.  Filled with the handsome people of all persuasions, it was a scene.  I set back the hip quotient exponentially.  Food was consistent and good.  Cocktails were made well, and throughout the restaurant liquor flowed.  You will have a good time at Portal.  Service was nice, but quite taken with itself.  Their flippant attitude was the one negative.
top_review_3:
Review by Collin Donoho 
Found this place on the Eaters guide and sure did not disappoint. They do have a sister bar next door as well. We walked into what seemed a very lowkey restaurant serving traditional Swedish fare with a twist. For our reservation, we sat at the bar, and it was lovely. The menu has many options, and the wine list is expansive. Service was fantastic by everyone, and super friendly. Everything we had was very tasty as well -

Review by Eleonore Lilja 
KB is a really classy and cosy place. The ambience feels luxury and historic, with the walls full of art. The food as well as the service keeps a high standard, and I’m always leaving feeling happy after dining at KB. Here you’ll find a mix of traditional Swedish food and some seasonal and modern new dishes. Really recommend this place for a great culinary experience.
top_review_2: null
top_review_3: null

top_review_1:
Review by Alexandros Tsakiris (Sigulf) 
It's a great place to bring friends who are visiting Stockholm. The atmosphere is great, and the presentation is also very good. The food served is not something you can find typically at restaurants, hence a bit "unique" in a good way that fits the overall visit. You can order a lot of mead (be careful) in a huge container to drink with friends. The overall experience is well-balanced the food is very good, on top of it.
top_review_2:
Review by Adrian Roos 
Lovely place to experience medieval atmosphere. Staff are telling encouraging stories. And you are only allowed to eat like the original people. Quite the experience. Besides that is the food just amazing. Both the main dish as the desert were astonishing. You also have a wide range of medieval beverages like mead that suit your meal. Go there! You won't be disappointed.
top_review_3:
Review by Antiopi Katsara 
Great place to visit to taste medieval food and some traditional Swedish mead. We were pleasantly surprised, as we thought it might be too touristic, but the quality of the food was really good and the staff was extremely kind and friendly. We mostly enjoyed the meatballs and the salmon mousse, which looked like an apple 🍎 Highly recommended.

top_review_1:
Review by Pyrognats 
We visited for a Christmas lunch. The set meal featured traditional Swedish Christmas starters like cold prawn hors d'oeuvre, lox, marinated herring with Kalix Löjrom, duck liver pâte, ham, Västerbotten cheese, crispbread and spice bread. This was followed by a warm main of duck breast with root fruits accompanied by fried kale. Dessert was a dark chocolate mousse topped with soft maraschino cherries and a fruit sobert. Drinks cost extra. Overall fantastic, professional staff, classic setting.

We were seated with a lovely view of a wintry Kungsträdgården. Food wise, the crisp bread and cheese were amazing and marinated herring was fresh. The duck breast was a letdown, overcooked and hard. The dessert is a chocolate and cherry lovers' delight but didn't appeal to me. My order of Chardonnay was a pleasant drink that was full of flavourful notes. The Swedish brewed coffee was a smooth medium roast that provided a good wrap up to our visit.

It is not mandatory to have the Christmas set as you can also order á la carte. Reservations recommended as this restaurant is very popular.
top_review_2:
Review by Joakim Troëng 
Decent, but just not there at all! We had the tasting menu and the flavors were to some extent both interesting and rewarding, but so many times just not well combined!  Also the service had problems helping us with our drink selection and didn't/couldn't present the dishes. The vanilla bavaroise and the entre toast were the best dishes!
top_review_3: null

top_review_1:
Review by Martins Freidenfelds 
WOW WOW. What an amazing experience. Everything was spot on and so well done. From welcome at doors and recognizing my girlfriend. Service was just superb smooth and professional. Food was just a dream every dish was so well done those amazing tastes. Seriously best food experience ever. Atmosphere so calming and relaxing music was just spot on. Thank you well done. Merry Christmas.
top_review_2:
Review by Nisha Isaac 
Having been to the three star Michelin restaurant La Sarte this past weekend I can wholeheartedly say that this restaurant in Stockholm is one that I am more likely to visit again.  The attention to detail and the service was top notch.  They noted my dislike of apples with the welcome drink and asked if I would like a substitution for an apple forward dessert.  The food was scrumptious and the kitchen operated seamlessly like a well oiled machine.  We had the best seats in the house allowing us to view the kitchen.  The meal at this restaurant is lingering in my memory as a favorite experience.   I look forward to our next visit.
top_review_3:
Review by Claire 
Fantastic Michelin Star restaurant. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Intimate feel, they only seat ~30 people in the restaurant every night. The non-alcoholic beverage pairing was great, each drink paired well with the food and had complex flavors with interesting ingredients and techniques used to make them. My pescetarian dinner was perfect, the celeriac root was the best vegetable I’ve ever eaten with such a tender texture and smoky, deep flavor. The food is all salty but food in Sweden is salty, it’s just a different flavor profile than places like England. Small portions but a lot of food, you will leave very full.

top_review_1:
Review by Amanda W 
Overall I would rate 3.5 stars considering the price level. Service was very good. Food was decent.

We were seated next to the tweed bar, and found this area to be less cozy than the other rooms at the restaurant. The air was stuffy and it got quite warm.
top_review_2:
Review by Marcus Widegren 
What can I say? Nordic haute cuisine I guess?

This establishment is a hidden gem in Stockholm. I've been to most places around town and this really blew my mind. We ate for two people and shared the dishes as this was our most preferred way of dining. Very fun and creative dishes. The complexity of the dishes were high and every herb was used in a very profound way - which matched the proposed wine in a very refined way.

What ever you decided to choose, please feel comfortable asking the staff as they are very knowledgable. We had some amazing food with a good tempo between meals to enjoy conversation and sip the excellent wine. I wish we had more time for drinks and if I would have re-made this evening I would most definitely plan for pre-drink or after drinks in the bar. Extra shout out to the staff that took care of us super well.

I really enjoyed walking into a strange entrance and revel in a new world. Staff 100%, raw material 100% and I really enjoyed other guests not being too much business people.

Make sure to reserve a table before as it is not easy to just drop by.
top_review_3:
Review by car engine 
We got the seasonal menu, which let us sample whole range of their main courses!

top_review_1:
Review by John Maull 
I had a great smorgasbord dinner at the Verandan. The food was delicious and bountiful, and gave me a great perspective on Swedish cuisine. The friendly waiter guided me through the eating experience, making sure that I added for right sauces to the dishes. Sadly, the smorgasbord at the Grand Hotel is only one of two left in Stockholm.
top_review_2:
Review by James Eisnor 
So the buffet is only available on weekends but I decided to come in anyway and do the three course meal for lunch. The staff was so kind and answered all questions I had about the food and the area.

Shout out to Roland who was my server. Such a kind man and gave me his personal recommendations for drinks and a brief history on red tea which I found very interesting. If I'm ever in Stockholm again I will definitely be returning
top_review_3:
Review by Val Bpsoma 
SWEDEN | Stockholm ! Nice view to the sea! Must book before you go!

top_review_1:
Review by Sonia A 
Absolutely LOVE this place. The food in the restaurant is amazing- we got the rice bowls and the butter and bread (both 10/10). The host and servers were so helpful and lovely. The rooftop bar is gorgeous, drinks are great and the atmosphere is amazing too. If you’re in Stockholm and don’t come here you’re missing out!!!
top_review_2:
Review by Nathan Rakaczky 
Your next after work spot. They have some great views of the city and wonderful food to match. Their sushi is fresh, with some mouth kicking wasabi. I can highly recommend the pork bao. It was melt in your mouth with a large portion to share with the table. They also had a fun take on oysters if your looking for some aphrodisiacs or just a good taste.
top_review_3:
Review by ooerim 
One of the best spots for the view, so so for the food.  As starters, we had oysters and brioche with mushrooms which were decent but the scallops with artichoke cream was really nice. For the main dish, sirloin steak with mushroom butter which wasn’t up to the expectation, it could be that we had a big group and it was prepared in a rush. And for desert, we had Japanese crème caramel with strawberries, which was quite similar to a usual crème caramel. So overall experience was positive but if I would come here again it would be more for the atmosphere rather than the food.

top_review_1:
Review by Johan Verhoeff 
We went here to enjoy our Christmas evening and we had a very nice experience. The restaurant is very cozy small, but for us it was part of the experience. The staff was very friendly and what attracted us most was the story telling of the dinner. Ours were sports themed and with each dish we got a interesting, funny story and delicious course served. Definitely recommend if your looking for something non standard dinner. Bit pricey, but the food was good quality!
top_review_2:
Review by E. T. 
The restaurant is very small, and sitting at the bar next to strangers that scream is not an ideal way to start your evening. Regarding the food (theme pancakes), nice presentation but rather uninteresting flavors and very small portions. We had the four course menu, and that was in no way adequate amount of food. The service was lovely but unfortunately not enough to even it out, we won't be coming back.
top_review_3:
Review by Orjana Lico 
I had a spot by the bar and ordered several dishes as per my own choice - ending up eating too much but I was happy about it. I loved it, every dish- from the reindeer snack, to bacalaitos and duck pancakes. The last meal, I opted for a vegetarian option, called okonomiyaki - one of the best meals of my life. It was an incredible explosion of flavors. I’d make the remark of too much salt as well, less would work equally well in the majority of the cases.
Service was adorable, absolutely. I had the feeling it’s one of this beautiful discoveries that will live long in my memories with the wish to come back and relive the same.

top_review_1:
Review by Arturo Sanchez 
Overall experience was fantastic. Impeccable service and the food is perfect. The atmosphere is so nice and comfortable that you feel at home.  They made a great champagne recommendation. It's very nice to be able to see the kitchen in front of you while they cook.
The place deserves it's reputation without any question
top_review_2:
Review by Joanna Ro 
Wow. What a place. This is 100% perfection, but without the attitude. The staff is lovely! Service is all through amazing. Food is divine and the whole experience a dream. Every little detail is well thought through and it was a pleasure to take part of the Frantzén experience. It felt like a saga. Bravo!!
top_review_3:
Review by John Elvesjö 
We come here once per year or so. This visit was my sixth after they changed location.
Everything was really good and we sincerely enjoyed it. Some change of staff was a bit sad to see but probably expected.
Some dishes have shrunk a bit and the total cost has reached a hard to motivate premium to other superb restaurants in Europe.
The premium wine package was in general a positive surprise, except for one wine that had clearly been opened for some time (there on a Tuesday and they are closed on Mondays).
We liked it better before they received the third star to be honest. I’m in no great hurry to come back, which has normally been the feeling after dining there.

top_review_1:
Review by Tobias Edvardsson 
The interior is beautiful and the staff is really caring. They catered for allergies really well and explained their lovely menu with ease. We all were able to find dishes we liked with clear guidance from the staff. Great wines with very reasonable prices.
top_review_2:
Review by Ivan Fatoni 
My company treated us to a delightful 5-course dinner at this establishment. Each dish was a culinary masterpiece, tantalizing our taste buds with every bite. The only minor drawback was the portion size; some of us found it to be on the smaller side. Nonetheless, the overall experience was thoroughly enjoyable, and the quality of the food left a lasting impression
top_review_3:
Review by Sonia A 
Came here for dinner and got 1 item each from each menu block as recommended. Definitely enough food. The food was so so delicious but just incredibly salty- everything was over-salted unfortunately. The taco was the show stopper for sure!
There was a bit of a wait between the 3 courses (50 minutes and 25 minutes) which felt a bit crazy but luckily we were happy to chat and catch up! The servers were lovely and maybe the wait times were an anomaly :)

I’ll definitely be back!!

top_review_1:
Review by Josefina Forstén 
Amazing food. Amazing chef, also super cute. But my favorite was the sommelier, he was so good, filled with knowledge about he wines and also super funny and cute. I wanted him to be my best friend. Lol. Amazing place, will definitely come back.
top_review_2:
Review by Swapnil Kumar 
Great vibes
top_review_3: null

top_review_1:
Review by Reina Furukawa 
The sophisticated Swedish food in Gothenburg. We had a course dinner, it came with bread, appetizer, main, and dessert. Everything was so tasty. Today’s drink with cucumber wad so fresh and tasty, and the staff was raking care of us and survive was good.
top_review_2:
Review by Anders Hansson 
Welcoming staff in cozy environment.

The food was good, but the fish dish was strangely under seasoned, must have been a mistake given that everything else was on par.

Good drinks and a small but nice selection of craft beers.
top_review_3:
Review by Jacques Botha 
We had a very good experience at Familjen. The restaurant is lovely decorated and have a relaxed atmosphere.
Our dishes was very flavoursome and beautifully presented. The portions was just right and we walked out feeling very satisfied.
I must make special mention of our waiter Theodore who was really good.
We ordered the menu and thought it was good value for money.
The special Bloody Mary cocktail was the best I've had.

top_review_1:
Review by Jan Näpärä 
I wasn't actually expecting anything special since I didn't even know this was a one star restaurant.

For a person not usual to visit these kinds of restaurants I think I got a bit scared. You eat everything together and it feels like a bit of a show.

The food was good, but for the price of the food i think that I can find many other places better than this. Maybe my tasting level is not there yet but I have eaten many many sushis around the world and I would say the fish was good but the sushi in total... It's just too boring for my taste. When they presented their signature dish I was just waiting for this perfection of dish and it was super beautiful but that's where the excitement stopped. The course was... Bland? It's super difficult to set a point on the restaurant because the quality of the ingredients were impeccable. It was just a disappointment to not experience this super good tasteful food.

I left still hungry which also for me tells that I wasn't satisfied. Did I get the feeling I would return? No. I am happy to try a one star restaurant and to realize that maybe I need to eat and taste more food before I can really enjoy this.
top_review_2:
Review by Eva Ströberg 
Sushi Sho served excellent sashimi and sushi. They were creative with the menu. For a one star Michelin restaurant, this place felt like a steal for the price. That said, they offered an extra menu with the tuna belly that almost cost like the entire meal

I wish they would just put that as option on the menu when we made the online booking, because it would be easier to decide and people more aware of this option, it’s just my two-cent.
top_review_3:
Review by RITA GULER 
A truly amazing omakase experience. They have 14 seats, which allows them to really take care of every diner. We had the sake pairing as well, which works quite well with the experience. They offer add on tuna items;  all must haves, my personal favorite was the tartare with caviar.

top_review_1:
Review by Emmm M 
We’ve been here for dinner a couple of years ago and the atmosphere and view is still the most romantic in Gothenburg. The food is good, my fish was amazing and my boyfriend’s veal was ok, but needed a proper meat knife. We actually asked for another knife but the second one was just as blunt as the first one... Still, it’s not “the best” food experience according to my very particular taste, but well worth the time and money. I’d come again, for the overall experience no doubt! We had the tartar starter that was good but over ambitious so some of the flavors are lost, to much going on, and the soup which was nice. Enjoyed everything. I have to give a comment about the service, best waitress in forever! Corona has certainly had an impact on what you expect but the service at View from the waitress was better than most places. 10 out of five stars for service without a doubt! Attentive, fast and friendly. Feels as friendly as your local pub but service at Michelin level. Amazing and I don’t know how you do it!
top_review_2:
Review by Jake Weston 
The food is absolutely fantastic and so is the view. The waitress was well spoken and a delight, spoke perfect English as most people do. Definitely worth splashing out on to enjoy yourself
top_review_3:
Review by Milos M 
Great atmosphere, impressive panoramic view with a very good food  and nice and friendly staff. It's really worth experiencing.

top_review_1:
Review by Xirley Calleja 
Best place for a nice lunch, especially if you want to try some authentic Swedish meatballs. We just walked in without reservation and that wasn't an issue at all. I also tried the fried egg starter which was equally delicious. The ambience is great, we sat by the bar. The service was also impeccable.
top_review_2:
Review by N 
Highly recommend if you are interested in taking some very delicious and authentic Swedish meatballs! I found this place on Yelp and decided to give it a go (after going to Ikea hehe) and the location is quite central. I was able to snag a small table off the bar area during a quiet moment in the evening. The staff was very efficient and friendly. I knew what I wanted immediately, but decided to take a peek at the menu anyway. I ordered the Swedish meatballs with lingdon berries and cucumbers served with potatoes and gravy. It was divine!!! I was also brought a plate of bread, which was very delicious! I highly recommend visiting!
top_review_3:
Review by Luca D 
Amazing ! Very nice restaurant, I love the atmosphere there! Nice staff and the food was very good! Here you can taste local dishes like Swedish meatballs

top_review_1:
Review by Scarlett 
Food was quite good, have tried the 6 meals and paring there.

Everything was good, nice food, tasty drink, super nice services!  Especially like the beef oyster tartar.

I liked everything, except the duck tart 😂 almost makes me want to puke from the thickness  of fat and jam.
top_review_2:
Review by François Meurisse 
The food was excellent, the recipes and ingredients absolutely delicious.

Only things to improve: the dinner was very long and lacked pace. 3h+ in total, because of 30 minutes wait time between courses. Would have been better with less wait time and an opportunity to finish below 2h30 total if we wanted - like other tasting menus we experienced in Michelin starred restaurants. The non alcoholic pairing lacked a little fantasy and fresh ingredients.

Still - congrats for the food and great restaurant
top_review_3:
Review by Sudharshan Ravi 
They are not flexible with accomodating food preferences even after you email them weeks in advance. They do not handle email communications, as it is a different part of the group that handles emails and reservations. Feels strange to use that as a reason when it is a Michelin star.

Food was good, we wanted to do 6 course but because of time constraints we could do only 4 course and they were very particular about the time. Not sure how regular 6 course menus fit within the allotted time.

Service was friendly but very very normal. Nothing more than a regular restaurant. Not a Michelin Star restaurant experience.

Overall, food was good but did not feel like a Michelin star AT ALL.

top_review_1:
Review by Matt Verett 
Excellent food, some of the tastiest Swedish meatballs that I have had in Stockholm. Also tried the Hunter's wrap, delicious! Highly recommend this place. One of the best restaurants I have eaten at during my trip here.
top_review_2:
Review by Rani Chabo 
You feel very welcome whenever you enter this place. They actually care that you walked in, just beautiful.

They certainly did their homework with the menu. Beautiful combinations of  flavours combined with good service.

I'll be seeing you soon again ❤️
top_review_3:
Review by YngYng 
The meatballs were magnificent, the best I've had in Sweden thus far and to say it was life changing would not be an exaggeration!

But be prepared to wait for a good 20min for these meatballs to be served. Worth the wait though! The chef mentioned he takes 2 hours to make these daily, ans I have to agree they taste incredible!

top_review_1:
Review by Abigail D'Souza 
Great entrees. cocktails were ok. The meringue dessert was only ok. Order the gambas, they were the best! You order 6-7 dishes and they bring out enough for your table.
top_review_2:
Review by Eveline Berg 
Visited with a large group of nine people for a birthday lunch and the information about sharing was a little bit confusing. We were both vegetarian and non-veg and it was impossible to just order two separate selections of tapas from the menu, the server wanted us all to order together which made the whole experience confusing and not so fun.

The servers also kept squeezing in between me and the table to get to the dishes or to serve food instead of politely announcing their presence and smoothly making their way, which annoyed me. They made me feel like I was in their way.

The food was good (above average I would say for the price point) but alot of what arrived at the table were not warm. Almost cold.

The atmosphere were that of a hotel restaurant I think, not very cosy, but it was located in connection to a mall so maybe that added to the not so cosy feeling.
top_review_3:
Review by Jenza 
Relaxed but upmarket atmosphere, super fast and professionalservice, tasty food - had the salmon/lax dagens menu, very nice. Recommended

top_review_1:
Review by Luke Phang 
We visited this place for a fancy dinner after a day of visiting museums. The service here was fantastic and we felt very welcomed as tourists, even though we may be underdressed for the occasion. The resident dog was friendly as well and added to the overall experience.

The food was great, but the ones that blew our mind away were the starters. We ordered the octopus and scallop, both which were fresh and tasted heavenly. The scallop melted in our mouth while the octopus was tender. Paired with the seasoning, they were the highlight of our meal.

We ordered the steak to share as our main. The beef was done to medium on default, which may have tasted tough to some people, and the cutting had a fatty portion that not many people may enjoy. Still it tasted decent, though it would not be the one of the highly rated beef we have tasted.

The interior itself was romantic, the ceiling height windows really added to the atmosphere. Good place to bring a date, with the sea view.

Overall, it was an enjoyable experience. Definitely made our trip memorable.
top_review_2:
Review by Shaina Kuo 
Absolutely amazing experience!
The food was so good - we took both fish and steak. Honestly, one of the best steak frites ever. Classic dishes with a very innovative and special twist. They have a nice wine list to choose from. The location is stunning! Special thanks to Bella for the best service ever :)
top_review_3:
Review by Julien van der waal 
Beautiful restaurant! Came here after visiting the ABBA Museum. The ambience within the restaurant is really cool with pretty art & boats tied to the ceiling. We all tried one of their pizzas and they were all very delicious, and affordable too. Service was really friendly and talkative, so we also had some nice conversations. Can highly recommend this restaurant if you get the chance to visit it!

top_review_1:
Review by Juliana Beltrán Díaz 
I only went there for a late night craving: a fondant au chocolat. They were about to close, but I asked for the dessert and lucky me the chef was there and offered me that last service. I appreciated that very much! She even took it to our table. I must say this is one of the most perfectly well done fondant au chocolat I've tasted (and I've tasted a lot!). A bit of crumble outside, spongy and moist inside, lava center, perfect temperature! The decoration was nice too, very well balanced.
top_review_2:
Review by Johnny Åkerlind 
We went to NOI for dinner with some friends. Food was good but some dishes wasn't, in my opinion, worth its price. The tuna (both starter and main) was really good and everyone in out company agreed that the tuna starter was the clear winner. Deserts were also good. Three of us had the beef as main which was a bit too tough for the price. For the price I expected something more tender.

Overall we had a nice experience, the staff was friendly although appeared a little stressed and you could tell we had to be done at a certain time to make room for the next sitting.
top_review_3: null

top_review_1:
Review by Monika Graj 
The food was amazing! From appetizers to main courses. Really recommend pasta with veil and truffles. Delicious. Good choice of wine as well. If you don’t have reservation don’t come. 🥲
top_review_2:
Review by Rein Northrop 
Delicious food. Noodles on the harder side. Good service but seating is a bit tight.
top_review_3:
Review by Lidia 
Spago is one of my favourite restaurants in Stockholm. The people working there makes the experience lovely. However, the food might be the best part of this place. Their pasta is amazing and also, great prices.

top_review_1:
Review by akhila nallaparaju 
Came for a short trip to Stockholm from Gothenburg and completely enjoyed the food here.

We ordered chicken biriyani and Mama’s coconut curry. Both of them were yum 🤌🏻♥️ I would definitely going to recommend this to others who visit Stockholm. Best Indian Restaurant in Sweden with authentic flavours
top_review_2:
Review by N K 
Good Indian tasty food. The quantity was lil less for the prices but that’s fine as the taste was awesome, the seating arrangement could have been better as the in house guests are more important than the once who book and do not turn up.
top_review_3:
Review by Pyrognats 
Recommend the cream chicken tikka for starters. This skewered chicken was fruity and savoury.

As for the the Ludhiyani Saag Mutton and Chicken Tikka Makhani, the dishes came with only a small serving of rice on the rice which the dish small. Seems there is an expectation to also order naan bread for a more complete meal.

The taste of the main dishes were ok, nothing to shout about. The flavours and serving style here including the mango lassi which was served in a bowl like a soup are very different from other Indian restaurants and I found the experience more expensive but less satisfying.

top_review_1:
Review by Tano D'Amore 
The overall experience at "IL Villaggio" in Stockholm was mixed. While the staff lacked professionalism, the food was commendable, offering a nearly authentic Italian taste. Consider it if you prioritize food quality over service.
top_review_2:
Review by My SISStories 
This is my boyfriend's favorite Italian restaurant and he took me here first time yesterday. Their spaghetti and pasta were great. Even thougt I'm usually not a pasta lover but I love both dishes we ordered. Service was nice same as the atmosphere. Next time I would like to try meat dish here. I love meat.
top_review_3:
Review by Javier Camacho Font 
Good staff, good food, and authentic italian at Stockholm. 100% recommended

top_review_1:
Review by Sebastian Wang 
Really great Indian food. Prices are fair, but quality is supreme. The super menu I ordered is almost enough for two people. The Masala and curry taste like a charm.
I would definitely try the chicken cuisine next time.
top_review_2:
Review by Rishin S 
Return visit after long time and really surprised with increase in quality of food .
Every item i tasted was close to perfection . Seems like a new chef; they have done a great job with food quality .
Service took a bit time - understandable given how the food turned out to be fredhöy prepared .
top_review_3:
Review by Patrick McCartney 
I don’t have many places like this where I’m from. With that said I think this is the best Indian food I’ve ever had. Definitely get the dosa (ghee is what we tried) and the Mango Lassi. They can also make it very spicy if that’s your thing. I would come back here next time I’m in Stockholm!

top_review_1:
Review by Matt Verett 
Excellent food, some of the tastiest Swedish meatballs that I have had in Stockholm. Also tried the Hunter's wrap, delicious! Highly recommend this place. One of the best restaurants I have eaten at during my trip here.
top_review_2:
Review by Rani Chabo 
You feel very welcome whenever you enter this place. They actually care that you walked in, just beautiful.

They certainly did their homework with the menu. Beautiful combinations of  flavours combined with good service.

I'll be seeing you soon again ❤️
top_review_3:
Review by YngYng 
The meatballs were magnificent, the best I've had in Sweden thus far and to say it was life changing would not be an exaggeration!

But be prepared to wait for a good 20min for these meatballs to be served. Worth the wait though! The chef mentioned he takes 2 hours to make these daily, ans I have to agree they taste incredible!

top_review_1:
Review by James Doohan (Jimi) 
Incredible pasta, literally savoured every bite. Thankfully didn't have to wait long for a table for 2 on the bar facing the kitchen. Vibe is cool. Prices are good. Felt very full at the end.
Had the pasta of the day and am still thinking about it.
top_review_2:
Review by Nicholas Galea 
Nestled among the busy market is a beautifully authentic Italian gem.

Ordered:
Pasta of the day - perfectly cooked pasta with pork, speck and a creamy saucy. Simply amazing dish

Mortadella with pepper and caper berries - the perfect starter to any dish or refreshing and moorish snack. Large portion that did not sacrifice on quality.
top_review_3:
Review by Giovanni Vajna de Pava 
Little place, half deli half diner.
Really good food, properly prepared.
Wish they had better coffee, but that's not their thing.
Definitely come here for lunch, but her in early as it gets crowded.

top_review_1:
Review by Gr. C. 
I visited this restaurant twice within 2 days. I really love the taste, I highly recommend tuna as starters, fish or mussels as main dish.
Their french fries are the best I’ve ever tried, the proportion of crispy shell and soft potato inside is really well controlled. And they’re Not oily at all! You can taste oil but it just adds more flavour in them.
top_review_2:
Review by Thomas Unander-Scharin 
Nice restaurant, good food and professional service. Thursday special: File of beef with pepper sauce. Busy place so make reservation!
top_review_3:
Review by Yani Wang 
Very typical French restaurant chatty atmosphere. The service is good and efficient. Food are nice and fair price. The duck liver was my favorite. Wines are generally ok - even house wine is tasty.

top_review_1:
Review by Silvia Lorenzo Rodríguez 
The food was so tasty and flavourful. It has been a while since I hadn't tried such good dishes. Looking forward to coming back ❤️
Unfortunately the deserts did not live up to the expectations of the savory dishes, something that happens in the majority of good restaurants sadly.
Something that could be a bit better is that we had to call the waiters every time we wanted something so a bit more attention would be appreciated.
All that said, I definitely recomend their food and a good indicator is that they are always fully booked, difficult to book on short notice 😜
top_review_2:
Review by Tararat Nowsaeng 
Very nice Peruvian foods and drinks. We followed the recommend of 3 meal course and not disappointed at all.
The foods are mostly seafood but there are options of vegetarian and non-seafood.
Recommend: mixto and belly-pork fried.
top_review_3:
Review by Lia Soleil

top_review_3:
Review by prathik_ 98 
I recently dined at this restaurant, and unfortunately, the experience was marred by the arrogant behavior of the staff. From the moment I walked in, I felt like an inconvenience rather than a valued customer. The servers were dismissive and we had to wait over 15 minutes despite having a reservation. When I asked questions about the menu, their responses were condescending and unhelpful. It's disappointing to have your dining experience soured by staff attitudes. The food may have been decent, but the lack of courtesy and respect from the staff left a lasting negative impression. It literally felt as if the staff was doing a favour on us by serving the food.

top_review_1:
Review by Anna J 
Very happy about what we got! Food was fresh and the combination was creative. We liked the artichoke dish. Zucchini on the side was juicy. For starter we took deer tartar and roe. The roe was simple but of good quality; deer tartar had crispy root vegetable on the top, which made the dish balanced and interesting. For desert we took wheat ice cream and puff pastry with yoghurt ice cream. Can very much recommend the wheat ice cream - such an unique taste! Usually we find restaurant desert very heavy and it would become almost a pain to eat with a full stomach, but their deserts were light and not that sweet, giving the whole meal a very nice end.
top_review_2:
Review by Liu Malory 
Swedish cuisine with a modern twist, I would give 4.5 stars coz there is an improvement that can be done.
The food materials of this place were selected from local providers, that is good not only because we could know the source of the food but also supporting local businesses.
The cured char fish had totally removed the fishy odor and the green tomatoes had neutralized the heaviness of the fish. It was very appetizing. The coriander cream with lamb was a genius combo, together with the multi types of veggies served, it was a dish that made you focus more on veggies than the meat. The flavors of veggies were brought up and enhanced by the flavors of lamb grease. The cloudberry pancake was served with melted brown butter, sounds greasy but in fact it was tasty, a perfect balance of milky and fruity flavors. It was a pity that I’m allergic to nuts and could not enjoy the almond ice cream, which I believe was better than the vanilla one.
The improvement can be done is the selection of the cut of the lamb. Mine piece of lamb had a lot of tendons inside, which was hard to chew on.

No doubt, my favourite lunch place in Stockholm! I've been here over 100 times and maybe once I didn't like my meal. Cosy, stylish building which was Electrolux factory back in a days. Food is awesome, service is friendly and helpful. I like seasonality of their cuisine - all the time there is a fresh fish in the menu, great quality lamb and wild meat during autumn season. Also, vegetarian options are so good that I started to eat more vegetarian foods

Terrible buffet restaurant, as I used to work in the same building and colleagues used to go there I joined quite a few times.

The only good thing I can say about the food in this place is that you can take something of everything some fish, some meat, some vegetarian and than just hope that one of those things is half eatable.

A big plus is that they seem to separate their garbage which makes me feel less bad throwing all the food I did not like.

I can honestly say that not a single time (I have been here 10 plus times) I have been happy with the food.

In any other place than in such a crowded office area this place would not survive.

My advice to this place would be skip the all you can eat option invest a bit more in the produce you buy and get a chef in with a team which actually likes making food, for me very clear this team (or owner) has no interest in serving quality.

The 2 star rating is for the fact that I have never got actually sick of the food and the fact that the coffee you can order outside of lunch hours is actually not half bad.

First of all, It’s not authentic chettinadu food. They mix the rice with a readymade curry when we ask for Biryani instead of cooking meat along with the rice . The lamb sukka rice had awful gamey smell of lamb instead of chetinadu masala’s smell. We couldn’t eat it past a couple of spoons and  left it on the table. Fish 65 was made out of salmon and I had no idea that we use Salmon in South Indian cooking . At least the waitress should have notified us. The chicken 65 was overcooked and rubbery. Speaking of the sides, we were served a day old or 2 days old lettuce which were so wilted.
They open the restaurant at 12 and we booked our table at 1.30.But by the time we reached there, they ran of parottas already. 😔😔😔😔

The beef tartar was very simple in the ingredients, unlike a lot of other places serving beef tartar with a lot of creamy sauce. Thus the original flavors of the meat was brought out properly. The mille-feuille was very crispy, and not overwhelmingly sweet, which was exactly to my liking. The pizza was the best I had in Stockholm, the pumpkin matched so well with the red pepper, spring onions and cheese. The bottom was super thin and crispy as well. However the squid with beans was not as pleasant as the other dishes, the flavors didn’t match with each other, and the odor of seafood was not removed.
The environment was a bit too dim and too crowded, that our neighbor’s butt almost ran into our plate when he tried to get into the seat.

Then we had several sashimis where all of them were really good but what striked me most was the scallops with foie gras, fresh truffle and caviar. It was explosion of flavours. Then we had several sushi pieces including three type of tuna, which of course fatty tuna was the highlight. Another sushi pieces to remember was the sea bream with lime and salt. The sushi courses ended with wagyu bite which was lightly torched in front of us. And the closure with a roasted sesame ice cream. The non alcoholic drink options were rich and suitable to pair with dishes. I can’t recommend enough if you would like to have an experience for a special day.

The pork and thousand-year egg porridge was very creamy yet still preserved the texture of lean pork and egg. The deep fried bread was super crispy and fluffy. The Chung Fun (steamed rice paper wraps) was silky smooth and perfectly seasoned. If you want to try authentic Cantonese Dim Sum (Cantonese Chinese tapas) in Stockholm, this is the place.
First visit June 2022: This might look like just another place serves terrible Chinese fusion, but actually it serves really authentic Cantonese cuisine during the weekends! The sweet pork buns are juicy and soft. The other Dim Sum are just like what I had in HK back in the days. Ambience and decor is fun and trendy. Service and staff were all friendly and helpful.

Only downside I would say is the price. At ~100-150kr ($10-15) a plate and 2-3 plates per person, the bill stacks up fast. If you come hungry and want a drink, be prepared to pay 500kr+ ($50) per person.

That being said I’d still come back and recommend this place for a special night out. Just not on the regular.

First evening in Sweden and went with friends on a trip to Taste of Bangla. The food, atmosphere, service and vibe was top notch. I have never had such eloquently placed creaminess along with spices that tantalized my palette. Ordered as a group and we got all of the naan flavors which were amazing (magical butter?); the butter masala chicken was sweetened beyond what I’m used to but it worked marvelously; the fire chicken pakora was insanely HOT and spicy but each bite left me wanting more; the tandoori chicken was amazingly juicy and came with a side of tandoori sauce to dip which was excellent; the lettuce wrapped paneer was mild, spiced well, and a perfect wrap up for the table; and the fresh made coconut ice cream (kokosglass) and kulfi were the best deserts to cool down the stomach and cleanse the palette at the end. Definitely a worthwhile visit if visiting Uppsala!

Review by Charlotte Alvord 
Ate the carnitas in naked burrito form, so everything without the tortilla. I added guacamole and substituted black beans for pinto beans. I love Mexican food and was really hoping that this would be a good experience, but I couldn't enjoy my meal. The carnitas meat and guacamole were so salty that after taking a few bites and I decided that it was way too salty, and I like salt, but this was just way too much. The pinto beans were undercooked so they were still hard, I had to spit them out. I couldn't enjoy the meal at all and decided that I could not eat it and had to send it back. So spoke to the girl behind the counter and she was really upset that it was inedible. She said that she would contact the kitchen and let them know. There is apparently one central kitchen in town and they then send out their already made dishes to the restaurants. So the food is not cooked at the restaurant's location, there is no chef/cook there.

I would give this place 0 stars, but am giving them 1 because they were nice and gave me my money back. The girl behind the counter contacted her boss and they decided to swish me the amount that I paid for; as they were having problems with their cashier system, which is totally cool and really appreciated that they found a solution even though the technology had crashed.

My suggestion is save your money, hop on the tram and go to Tom Toms in Linnéstaden. Much better food, there they cook their food at the location and I have eaten there several times, with always a good experience each time.

Sorry Wrapped Burrito Bar, you won't be having me as a customer again.

Review by N H 
Went to the rooftop bar 4 times now and didn't have good service but the last time we were there was a new personal called Andrea and she was very attentive and the service was 10 times better. Overall, good beer and the sweet potato  fries are just the best. Big plus for having some sour beer from Brewski. We will come back again for sure!! :)
UPDATE one year later: They changed the beer menu and now only have okk beer that you can find anywhere. They also stopped serving the sweet potatoe fries and the beer that I liked. I was really disappointed and will not come here again.
top_review_2:
Review by H Giang Bui 
We were at Ama rooftop bar on the 8th floor, just to be clear since Ama restaurant in the 1st floor and Ama rooftop bar have slightly different food and drink menu. The view was great, fancy furnishings and friendly service. The drink, especially the mocktails, can be improved, they taste a bit boring and similar to each other, the decoration and choice of glass weren't very impressive. The food were fine, recommend steak sandwich. Fair price. Very curious to come back to see the difference in Ama restaurant in 1st floor and try the classic cocktails there.

Review by Jayesh Khatri 
The food was amazing complemented by great service.

We were lucky to get a good table in a slightly silent corner but in general the restaurant felt small and congested. But that I guess is a common thing in Sweden.

Overall, highly recommended!
top_review_2:
Review by Bastiaan 
Amazing atmosphere inside and overall quality and service minded staff. Well done!

The quality of the dishes varies. Desserts were great, but the main was another story.

Don't order the steak tartar if you expect a classic dish, because here it's buried under a load of other things. If you don't know what it is: order it because it still tastes good, but not as a steak tartar. The wonton dish was excellent.

We had some simple starters  (chips and padron), they were overpriced. And for the padron the same: don't expect the classic Spanish dish!

But overall a cosy place with good food, atmosphere and staff.

Nice place, but extremely crowded. No space to hang your coat, purse, also no fresh air inside, overwhelming with strong smells from the kitchen.

The food is delicious, just too salty on my opinion. Stuff is great and super friendly.
